Oakland County is diverse in its types of communities. These range from blue-collar to elite communities. It is ranked as one of the richest counties in the United States with over 1 million people.
English is the predominant language in and around Oakland county, and there are no strange dialects unique to this area.
There are many interstate highways leading in and through the county. Also, charter plane service is provided by
. Also, commercial services are provided by
Oakland Country is huge! Do not depend on public transportation. A car is needed and if you do not have one, rent one. Also there is limited bus services provided by SMART.
There are plenty of malls and concert venues located throughout Oakland County.
If shopping is your thing then head to
. This Mall is the biggest, sorry guys this is not an outlet mall be prepared to spend and walk a lot. Somerset Collection is located on Big Beaver (16 mile) and Crooks.

value: content=A car fanatic's paradise, this is an informal drive along Woodward Avenue from Ferndale to Pontiac, where anything imaginable can be seen, from Vipers to vintage cruisers to tricked-out garbage trucks. Happens every August at the height of summer.

There are many places to eat in Oakland County, however if you are into the non-franchise type restaurants try
. It is located inside Oakland Mall which is on the corner of I-75 and 14 mile Rd. The service is top notch, the food is to die for and the atmosphere is warm and inviting.

value: content=Housed in an old church, great atmostphere, even better food. Mac-n-Cheese is to die for, and only $5 for a half order which is more than filling. House dressing is amazing. Menu goes from $5-50. Beautiful bar, non-standard beers & wines to choose from.
content=The original Detroit style Pizza place. Deep dish pizza with a deep crust. Constructed with a crisp exterior and a doughy interior Buddy's crust is not to be missed.

If the Club/Bar scene is your thing then head to downtown

. Tiki Bob's Cantina, Tonic, Sevin, and Clutch Cargos are some of the popular destinations. There are lots of bars and you won't be disappointed. In addition, if you like the more classy atmosphere go to Downtown Birmingham for Blue Martini or Royal Oak.

Almost the entirety of Oakland County is safe, but take precautions when traveling on the southwest border near 8 mile road as it can get a little seedy. However if you're looking for drugs, that's the place to be.
Parts of Pontiac can be a little dodgy as well.  Exercise common sense and be aware of surroundings at all times.
